p: Several pro‐resolution molecules have been shown to decrease effectively inflammation and injury in models simulating pulmonary disease, including asthma, fibrosis, and infection. In the context of asthma, local or systemic administration of hydrogen peroxide (Reis et al., 2015), angiotensin‐(1–7) (Magalhaes et al., 2018), ANXA1(Bandeira‐Melo et al., 2005), and LXA4 (Levy et al., 2007) all decrease infiltration of eosinophils in the lung and, in general, changes in airway function. Similarly, mediators of resolution decrease inflammation, injury, and fibrosis in bleomycin‐induced pulmonary fibrosis (Damazo et al., 2011; Rago et al., 2019) and silicosis (Trentin et al., 2015).
